main event: On January 21, 1954 in Waco, Texas, a bright white light was observed approximately 12 miles east of an aircraft, proceeding from north to south at low speed. The sighting was made by four air crew members.
interesting points: The sighting was reported as a CIRVIS (Communications Instructions for Reporting Vital Intelligence Sightings) incident.
The UFO was described as a bright white light, and the observation was made in clear weather.
The object was seen at 19000 feet and was visible to four crew members.
The report states that there was no further action taken due to insufficient data.
The document suggests possible explanations for the sighting, such as balloon, aircraft, or astronomical object.
